item.title: Harry Potter The Complete Collection
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: The First-Time Manager - the ultimate guide for every new manager that will describe all the aspects a newbie will face on his new position.
item.content:encoded:
The First-Time Manager – the ultimate guide for every new manager that will describe all the aspects a newbie will face on his new position. This book have already helped thousands of people to feel themselves confident and comfortable being a manager, and it still helps.

Clear and concise, the book covers all the fundamentals you need for success, with indispensable advice on topics including hiring and firing, leadership, motivation, and managing time and stress. In addition, the completely updated fifth edition shows you how to build trust and confidence, be an active listener, manage a diverse group of individuals, conduct performance appraisals, and address many other challenges that come with the manager’s job.

Written in an inviting and accessible style, this classic skill-building book is an essential tool for becoming an effective, confident new manager.

item.title: The Hunger Games Trilogy
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: It’s OK to Be the Boss -  do you feel you don’t have enough time to manage your people? Do you avoid interacting with some employees because you hate the dreaded confrontations that often follow? Do you secretly wish you could be more in control but don’t know where to start?
item.content:encoded:
It’s OK to Be the Boss –  do you feel you don’t have enough time to manage your people? Do you avoid interacting with some employees because you hate the dreaded confrontations that often follow? Do you secretly wish you could be more in control but don’t know where to start? This stunning book will help you to answer all those questions!

According to over 15 years research on the front lines of the workplace, Bruce Tulgan, author of “It’s Okay to be the Boss,” with his fearless attitude to life and work is affecting managers at all levels of the organizations and in all industries.

Based on his extensive research the author suggests another way—a clear, step-by-step guide to becoming the strong manager employees need. It challenges bosses everywhere to spell out expectations, tell employees exactly what to do and how to do it, monitor and measure performance constantly, and correct failure quickly and reward success even more quickly.

item.title: The Complete Sherlock Holmes
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Yet a true leader will find it difficult to get anywhere without some basic people management skills. He or she will seek to create relaxed workplaces in which people have all the time they need to pursue important goals. This sense of relaxed purpose arises because everyone knows exactly what their role is; there is both transparency and clarity of purpose.
item.content:encoded:
The One Minute Manager – This book by Kenneth Blanchard  is unlike any other book of its genre. It is written in a story format. Opening pages arouse such kind of curiosity that it make you jump straight into it. In this 100-page story, a man is in search of an effective manager. Throughout his journey he learns many lessons.

A young man searches all over the world for an example of a great manager. He wants to work for one and learn how to become one. But most of the workplaces he has seen do not provide any great inspiration. He meets hard-nosed managers who get things done but who the staff do not much like, and nice managers who love their staff but do not pay enough attention to the bottom line.

Yet a true leader will find it difficult to get anywhere without some basic people management skills. He or she will seek to create relaxed workplaces in which people have all the time they need to pursue important goals. This sense of relaxed purpose arises because everyone knows exactly what their role is; there is both transparency and clarity of purpose.
